A sheet provides alternate values for various configuration options. A shee=
t association specifies when to apply the sheet. This is typically done by =
specifying a list of SURTs.

E.g. You may want to impose stricter politenes=
s rules when crawling example.com. Thus you would create a sheet where disp=
osition.minDelayMs was set to 10000 ms rather than the default 2000 ms. The=
 sheet assocation would then list the SURT "http:\\(com,example," 

The She=
etOverlayManager is the part of Heritrix that is responsible for managing t=
hese sheets and assocations. It knows what sheets exist and what assocation=
s are in effect.

In the cited code example the sheet overlay manager is be=
ing invoked so that the correct configurations are set for the current Craw=
lURI.

- Kris
